general_feedback: It does not feel fair for people without any English knowledge of speakers of minority languages
Many people would not be able to understand what to do.

challenge_feedback: No. I don't like Captchas. They are annoying and routinely used for purposes others than their stated one, i.e. identification - e.g. machine learning training.

I like the idea of this type of challenge, but it would work better with related words rather than related senses of words, or at least with more easily-separable word senses. People have a notoriously high level of disagreement re: relatedness of word senses. The example I had was especially challenging, as some instances used "part" as part of a verb ("take part") and others used it as a more typical noun.
general_feedback: I'm a computational linguist. I'm definitely not the average user :)

challenge_feedback: No, images are still easier to get the gist of it and they are faster to solve as the visual apparatus functions faster then the reading one
